title: Urban Meyer offered Ronnie James scholarship during last Rutgers-Ohio State week
text:

Post to Facebook Urban Meyer offered Ronnie James scholarship during last Rutgers-Ohio State week PISCATAWAY – Even though he was a Glassboro High School student at the time, Ronnie James found himself in the middle... Check out this story on mycentraljersey.com: http://mycj.co/1RZpVlf Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation Ryan Dunleavy, @rydunleavy 3:41 p.m. EDT October 22, 2015 Freshman cornerback Ronnie James (5) followed in the footsteps of his older brother Paul James (34) by coming to Rutgers.(Photo: Ben Solomon/Courtesy of Rutgers athletics communications) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
PISCATAWAY – Even though he was a Glassboro High School student at the time, Ronnie James found himself in the middle of the Rutgers-Ohio State game week last season. 
A few days prior to the first meeting between the Big Ten East Division members, James, a Rutgers-bound recruit, received a scholarship offer from Ohio State coach Urban Meyer. 
“It was a great experience to receive an offer from Ohio State," James said, "but I already knew that Rutgers was the right place. It was the best fit for me." CB Ronnie James could've joined #GoBucks. Now he's against them. Why he picked #RFootball in recruiting: https://t.co/CnxFCHPmxF#Rutgers— Ryan Dunleavy (@rydunleavy) October 22, 2015
